content.thinking: Looking at this document, I need to extract all the visible text and then classify it. From the document, I can see two identity-style documents: Top document: - "REPÚBLICA DE COLOMBIA" - "IDENTIFICACIÓN PERSONAL" - "CÉDULA DE CIUDADANÍA" - "NÚMERO 5.820.956" - "MONTES MONTES" - "APELLIDOS" - "JORGE EMILIO" - "NOMBRES" - There's a signature and what appears to be a photo Bottom document: - "SINCELEJO" - "(SUCRE)" - "05-SEP-1955" (appears to be a date) - "1.73" (appears to be height) - "M" (likely gender) - "04-JUN-1977 SINCELEJO" - There's a fingerprint and barcode - Various other fragmentary text This appears to be a Colombian identity card (Cédula de Ciudadanía). The key indicators are: - "REPÚBLICA DE COLOMBIA" - "IDENTIFICACIÓN PERSONAL" - "CÉDULA DE CIUDADANÍA" - Personal information (name, number) - Photo and signature - Fingerprint - Biographical data (birth date, place) This clearly fits the CECRL category as it's an official personal identification document with all the typical characteristics: - Individual identification terminology - Personal biographical data - Individual photo, signature, fingerprint - Government-issued personal ID number with individual name - Security elements Let me extract all the visible text carefully:
